Rembrandt Harmensz. van Rijn (1606-1669).ArtName: Self-Portrait in a Cap and Scarf with Face dark: Bust
Rembrandt Harmensz. van Rijn (1606-1669).About: etching, 1633, on laid paper, a fine impression of New Hollstein's second state (of five), laid down onto a support sheet, with thread margins, partially remargined, a short tear with an associated tiny paper loss at upper right, a short tear at the lower left sheet corner, a few other small, very skilfully repaired defects, the subject in very good condition P., S. 142 x 111 mm.

Pablo Picasso.ArtName: Quatre Femmes nues et Tête sculptée, from: La Suite Vollard
Pablo Picasso.About: etching and engraving, 1934, on Montval laid paper, watermark Vollard, signed in pencil, from the edition of 260 (there was also an edition of fifty with wider margins), published by A. Vollard, Paris, 1939, the full sheet, a deckle edge at left, in very good condition P. 223 x 316 mm., S. 340 x 450 mm.

Pablo Picasso (1881-1973).About: signed and dated 'Picasso 25.10.39.' (lower left); dated again and inscribed '25.10.39. Royan' (on the reverse) oil on canvas 28 ¾ x 23 5/8 in. (73 x 60 cm.) Painted on 25 October 1939

Louis Marcoussis (1883-1941).About: fixé sous verre 66 x 34.7 cm. Peint vers 1923  fixé sous verre 26 x 13 5/8 in. Painted circa 1923
